text:
Craig Revel Horwood (born 4 January 1965) is an Australian-British professional ballroom dancer, choreographer, conductor, singer, author, and theatre director. He is best known for the West End role been the first series as a judge panelist on the BBC One popular dancing show "Strictly Come Dancing" since 2004, and for his patron of the "Royal Osteoporois Society."
On the "Ballroom and Latin routine" show "Strictly Come Dancing", Horwood is also often seen performing themed on the Hello, Dolly musical, during performance since he included 2019.
